TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
A small piece of cotton is taken.
The wash bottle containing spirit is taken and a small volume of spirit is squeezed onto the cotton to make it wet.
A clean glass slide is taken.
wiped with the cotton.
The slide is placed on a paper.
Preparation of Agarose.
The power supply is switched on.
A weighing paper is placed on the weighing balance.
Tare the weighing balance.
The bottle containing agarose is opened.
0.300g of agarose is weighed out.
The weighed agarose is then transferred to a conical flask.
The bottle labeled as 1X assay buffer is taken.
Open the bottle labeled as 1X assay buffer.
Pour the 1X assay buffer in to the measuring cylinder.
Pour the 1X assay buffer in to the measuring cylinder.
25 ml of the measured assay buffer is poured into the conical flask containing agarose.
The solution is mixed by gentle shaking.
The conical flask containing agarose is kept in a microwave oven for 2 minutes to make the agarose soluble.
After 2 minutes, the conical flask is taken out.
The solution is allowed to cool for sometime.
Preparation of Gel plate.
4ml of the agarose solution is poured onto the gel plate.
4 ml of agarose solution poured on to the gel plate.the agarose is allowed to set for 30 minutes.
Now, the template is taken and is placed on a paper.
The glass plate with agarose is taken and is placed on top of the template.
Take the gel punch with syringe hold the tip of the gel puncher and place it on the gel corresponding to the markings on the template.
Take the gel punch with syringe hold the tip of the gel puncher and place it on the gel corresponding to the markings on the template.
Then the piston is pulled up slowly so that part of the gel gets into the tube of the puncher making wells in the gel.
Accordingly, three wells are made on the gel.
Now, the wells are marked on the opposite side of the plate with a marker.
A micropipette is taken and the volume is adjusted to 10 micro litre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as antibody is taken from the ice box.
10 micro litre of antibody solution is pipetted out.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The well labeled as antibody (Ab) is filled with the 10 micro litre of antibody solution taken in the micropipette.
The well labeled as antibody (Ab) is filled with the 10 micro litre of antibody solution taken in the micropipette.
The used tip is discarded.
A micropipette is taken and the volume is adjusted to 10 micro litre.
A fresh tip is inserted.
The vial labeled as Antigen1 is taken from the ice box.
10 microlitre of antigen solution is pipetted out.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The well labeled as Antigen1 (Ag 1) is filled with the 10µl of antigen solution taken in the micropipette.
The well labeled as Antigen1 (Ag 1) is filled with the 10µl of antigen solution taken in the micropipette.
The used tip is discarded.
A fresh tip is inserted.
A micropipette is taken and the volume is adjusted to 10 micro litre.
The vial labeled as Antigen1 is taken from the ice box.
10 microlitre of antigen solution is pipetted out.
The vial is kept back in the ice box.
The well labeled as Antigen2 (Ag 2) is filled with the 10µl of antigen solution taken in the micropipette.
The well labeled as Antigen2 (Ag 2) is filled with the 10µl of antigen solution taken in the micropipette.
The used tip is discarded.
notext
A Petri plate is opened and a small piece of cotton is placed inside it.
A small volume of water is squeezed from the wash bottle onto the cotton to make it wet.
The gel plate is taken and is kept inside the chamber.
The lid of the plate is closed and is incubated at 37˚C overnight.
The lid of the plate is closed and is incubated at 37˚C overnight.
After incubation, opaque precipitin lines are observed between the antigens and antisera wells.
After incubation, opaque precipitin lines are observed between the antigens and antisera wells.
After incubation, opaque precipitin lines are observed between the antigens and antisera wells.
